revised_title: Albert Heim: A Pioneering Geologist and Educator
tldr: Albert Heim was a renowned Swiss geologist and educator who made significant contributions to the understanding of geological folding and the geology of Switzerland. Heim was a student of the celebrated Professor of Geology, Arnold Escher von der Linth, and went on to succeed him as a professor at Zurich Polytechnic and Zurich University. Heim's research and publications, including his groundbreaking work on the "Mechanism of Mountain Building" and the "Geologie der Schweiz," have had a lasting impact on the field of geology. Heim was also a skilled artist and created numerous geological models and illustrations throughout his career.
